text: One of the most popular sitcoms of the
21st century is, of course, How I Met
Your Mother. But there are quite a few
things that happen behind the scenes of
this hilarious show that you probably
don't know about. Welcome to Trending
10, and today we're counting down the
top 10 things that you probably didn't
know about How I Met Your Mother. Ready?
Because here we go. Many of the cast
significant others appeared as extras on
the show, but as a little inside joke,
the significant others were only allowed
to play bizarre characters. For example,
Allison Hanigan's husband played the
weird newscaster Sandy Rivers. Kobe
Smolder's husband appeared as Gary
Blowman, and Neil Patrick Harris's
husband played Scooter, Lily's high
school boyfriend. On-screen couple Lily
and Marshall had a little bit of drama
during filming. Marshall was played by
Jason Seagull, who had a smoking problem
at the time of filming. And Lily's
actress, Allison Hanigan, hated kissing
Seagull on screen because it was like
kissing an ashtray. Seagull managed to
quit for a year, but eventually picked
the habit back up. The original cast of
the show looked very different from what
we know today. Originally, Scott Foley
was planned to play Ted and Jennifer
Love Hewitt was planned to play Robin.
He would eventually turn down the role
so she could be on the new CBS show
Ghost Whisperer, which unfortunately
didn't go too well for her. There was a
lot of confusion around the character
Stella. Pop star Britney Spears had
expressed interest in being on the show,
but the producers were actually worried
that Spears would want to play Stella, a
character that they had big plans for
and did not want Spears to play.
Luckily, Spears was more interested in
playing Stella's receptionist, Abby. The
episode that Britney Spears appeared on
titled 10 Sessions went on to be the
most popular episode at the time and
ended up saving the show from
cancellation. Stella was then planned to
be played by Alicia Silverstone. But
after Spears was recruited to play
Stella's receptionist, Silverstone's
representatives made her pull out of the
show in fear that her performance would
be overshadowed by Britney Spears.
Eventually, Sarah Clark was signed on to
play Stella, and she ended up being the
great final choice. Penny and Luke had
to film their scenes at the end of the
show 9 years early. Fearing that the
kids would go through puberty before the
ending of the show, the crew had to film
Penny and Luke's scenes in the finale
all the way back during season 1 of the
show. The two kids even had to sign a
confidentiality contract, which of
course they honored. And 9 years later,
the world got to see the scenes that the
kids shot all the way back in season 1.
Most sitcoms are recorded in front of a
live studio audience, but the pilot
episode of How I Met Your Mother was
actually recorded in a regular studio
without an audience. In fact, the pilot
episode took a whole 3 days to film, as
there were far more scenes than the
production team expected. Once the
episode was finally finished, it was
shown to an audience whose laughter was
recorded and added to the sound mix of
the pilot before it aired. Did you know
that Conan O'Brien actually appeared on
the show? but he didn't appear in the
way you might think. You'd probably
expect someone of Conan's caliber to
have a lead role, but believe it or not,
Conan actually entered a charity auction
to be an extra on the show and won.
After winning the auction, the producers
of How I Met Your Mother wanted to give
Conan a larger part, but O'Brien
declined the offer, thinking that it
would be much funnier if he was just
somewhere in the background. So, on the
episode No Pressure, Conan appears in
the background as a regular extra. The
gang likes to hang out at the bar
McLarens. But there's more real about
this bar than you probably know. The
name comes from Carl McLaren, who worked
as an assistant to the producers of the
show for 2 years before How I Met Your
Mother started production. The actual
bar is based on a New York City bar
called McGee, where the producers hung
out while working on their previous
show, Letterman. Did you know that there
was a real proposal on the set of the
show? During the filming of the season 2
finale, one of the extras in the
restaurant scene, Timothy Russo,
proposed to a fellow extra, Jana Rugan.
Russo's brother's friend was one of the
writers for the show and managed to help
organize the entire thing. Perhaps the
most memorable character on the show is,
of course, Barney, played by the
legendary Neil Patrick Harris. But did
you know that Neil wasn't actually the
first choice for the character? Barney
was originally supposed to be played by
Jim Parsons, whom many know as Sheldon
on The Big Bang Theory. However, at
auditions for the show, Parsons was beat
out by Harris for the role, and a good
thing he did. If things had gone
differently, Barney would not be the
character we know and love today, and
The Big Bang Theory likely wouldn't have
Jim Parsons as Sheldon. So, we'll just
call it a happy incident. But there we
go, guys. That's it for our list of 10
things you probably didn't know about
the hit TV sitcom How I Met Your Mother.
Got any other sitcom facts? Be sure to
let us know down in the comment section
below. And if you enjoyed this video,
drop a like and subscribe for more great
content. But all right, that's going to
be it for this one, guys. Thanks so much
for watching Trending 10, your guide to
what's viral right
